comment: She seems like a kind lady, I wish she were a better teacher. She is very disorganized. Instructions are unclear. Online lectures are clunky and hard to work with. Her answers to questions don't make sense. I wouldn't take her again. To her credit, she is very kind and lenient with deadlines.the work isnt awful. Overall, not good but not the worst?

She's a great professor. Only thing is sometimes the assignments would be kinda confusing but you would get the jits of it once you reread the instructions a 100 times. The final is you acting out in a "play."  The video only had to be one minute and yes it was kinda embarrassing but it was an easy 100. Overall not to hard of a class.
As far as the workload, she definitely gives more work than other TPS 1107 professors. The assignment instructions are very poorly written. However, you can easily cheat through this entire class.

The professor is an okay teacher although given the choice I would not take her class again. The assignments she gave were simple the only problem would be the instructions for each assignment as she would often contradict herself and leave the whole class confused. 2 mandatory events Watch out for random assignments she never mentioned popping up.

Loved this professor! Assignments were quite easy and straight to the point. However, you do have to see 2 shows outside of class time and pay for the tickets yourself. She gives feedback on assignments and works with you. Extremely easy class and would take again!

The class overall is okay. But as far as the theatre performances go, you must type at least 5 or more paragraphs. We had to write a script and act it out for the final. I think it's too much work for someone who does all of my assignments; she needs to stop so much with the heavy workload. So for that, I wouldn't take the class again
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--So many papers

comment: the class itself was alright however the assignments and the syllabus often contradict each other, or instructions for assignments were unclear. overall, it's not a lot of work but it's easy to get confused.

She's pretty unclear when it comes to explaining when assignments are due and what the assignment entails. Currently, we're supposed to write a "discussion-based style essay", but the way she worded It made it seem like it could go either way. So if anything, she needs to communicate better.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--So many papers--Test heavy

comment:
I don't know where all these reviews about Professor Keyton being rude are coming from. 

She was extremely supportive of me during several family tragedies and health issues; and honestly I could have easily replaced my I with an A if I wasn't focused on simply getting by in the class so I can take more time off to heal ASAP.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Caring--Accessible outside class

comment: Confusing assignment instructions, due dates and communication. Put multiple things in as zeros weeks before they were due. She expects more time put into her class than every other Gen ED course I've taken combined while also being rude and unresponsive in emails.

Material was so unorganized and due dates were confusing. Not very clear on grading criteria. It wasn't difficult, mainly just one assignment a week, but it was just incredibly confusing. Had to see one performance in person and only a couple of big assignments.

Her class was veryyy easy. You had like one thing due a week IF THAT. She was a very easy grader and if you just did the work you will be fine and get an A. Her due dates can be confusing and hidden but other than that easy A.

TPS 1107 online. Easy class as long as you keep up with your work. Assignments due every Monday, majority of weeks it is a simple assignment. Two easy papers, a few discussions that also were not too difficult. She is also very helpful and lenient.
this class was a breeze. One quiz weekly over the lectures, barely any class work. She responds to emails quickly and gives multiple chances on the quiz, you literally can not fail this class.

This was a pretty easy Course. It was pretty quiz heavy, but most answers you can find online. Your final consist of going to a play and doing a writing assignment. VERY easy. I would recommend for a quick A.

She gives misguided and confusing information. On multiple occasions, there has been multiple due dates and sets of instructions for ONE assignment. When you email her to ask a question, shes kind of rude and does not answer questions. I was in a groupme with my classmates, and we were all constantly confused and frustrated with this professor.

shes honestly a great profesor. theres 2 required preformances you have to watch but theyre free. you have to write an essay on both of them. you have weekly quizzes about plays but there are unlimited attempts and not webcame. the final consisted of writing a script and creating an animation or act the scene out. easy A.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: extremely rude. gives 4 sets of directions for 1 assignment. a part time professor yet expects you to spend 100/168 hours a week on just her class work. easy yet time consuming work w/unrealistic deadlines. lots of reading & quizzes (lockdown no webcam) & discussions & you have to comment on peers. have to attend 2 plays. Not worth the STRESS.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: Honestly this online class was extremely confusing and unorganized. She gives 3 sets of directions for 1 thing, when you do find out the true directions its basically participation. There are many quizzes with multiple attempts (uses lockdown/ no webcam). Multiple discussions, one project (the final). Easy A. You won't really learn anything though.

It can be confusing when you first get into the class but after that it's fine. It is an easy A but just do the work and you will be fine. She is a bit unorganized. I would take her if you are only trying to get your credit. You do have to attend two plays but if you usher then you don't have to pay.

This is probably the most miserable I have ever been in an online class. Easy A but the assignments were confusing a majority of the time and some directions were unclear. Quizzes are super easy and discussions are too. Just do the assignments and youll do fine. Take this class if you dont care about learning about theatre and just want to pass.

Kind of rude in responses to questions. Not a lot of work. Very unorganized and contradicts herself a lot in directions. It is easy to make an A however. Took her online. She uses lockdown browser but no webcam. All of the work took very little effort. Probably the best option for this class. I wouldnt take in person, but recommend taking online!

Quizzes are super easy. Not lockdown browser. Easy assignments throughout the semester until the final. Its overwhelming at the beginning bc she gives 4 different sets of directions. But once you figure it out, its easy. TERRIBLE at getting in touch with you though. In an online class she only communicates through a discussion board on D2L.

Around 12 online quizzes lock down browser, 1st couple of Q's were not timed the last couple were. U Have to attend 2 plays and write an essay purchase tickets ASAP. Final Exam is a story telling that you choose a folktale and create it into a video. Easy grade just make sure to mark your calendar for due dates, & you will be all set.

easiest A ever!! I took this online. everything is pretty much just discussion posts which I got a 100 on every single one. few quizzes but you get unlimited attempts and it tells you what you got wrong each time. I didn't even get the book and I finished with a 97. only bad thing is you have to go to 2 plays.

EASIEST A YOU CAN EVER GET ONLINE. this class is mostly discussions but the teacher is an easy grader for sure! I get 100s on mostly everything. You can retake quizzes 3 times and it tells you what you got wrong. So by the 3rd time I get a 100. Only downside is you have to pay for 2 tickets to go to plays. I spent 26$ between the 2 out of my own $

This class is disorganized, but nothing you can't handle! Stay in contact with the professor and ask for help right when you need it- don't wait till the last minute. You are required to attend two plays, and you must read a few plays as well. There are quizzes and discussions every week, often times you can take quiz multiple times. Extra credit!

Her d2l is very un-organized and confusing at first; you can figure it out quick. There is one minute post due every monday night, and it takes less than 20 minutes to do each week. I got a 100+ on 13/15 of them, bonus points are offered often. 2 required plays to attend, just follow the directions on every post and you shouldn't struggle.

I wouldn't recommend this professor to my worst enemy. She is the least organized professor I've ever had. She is condescending - if you criticize her organizational skills, she'll remind you that online courses are tough. I'd HIGHLY recommend skipping this teacher for a more seasoned pro. This aint Juilliard; were non-theater majors.

She's so unorganized and doesn't help at all. You can't have a teacher help you if she doesn't know what is happening in the class. Her D2L makes no sense. If your're taking this class be prepared to figure out the assignments yourself. Directions don't help.

I took her online. She has really easy assignments. A weekly discussion post that might include a quiz if there is a reading assignment. I had to purchase two books for the class. We also were required to attend two plays. There are make-up plays. The final project consists of creating a 3-5 minute video explaining a story.

Everything is pretty easy except for the final exam. It is so unnecessarily confusing and nothing prepares you for it. She does not give clear instruction at all about it either. She's alright though, you also have to do some reading to understand the discussion posts.

The class is an easy A, but Keyton is all over the place with her directions. I took this class online and a lot of her directions were clearly copy and pasted from another class and a lot of things didn't apply. She wasn't really clear with anything so it was a bit confusing at times but I got As on pretty much everything without much effort.

Very easy class, I received 100s on basically every assignment without putting forth too much effort. Attend 2 plays, read 2 plays, discussion post every week. Final is a decent amount of work but its not difficult. If you're looking for and easy A take this class.

Love Mrs. Keyton!!!!!! She gives tons and tons of chances for extra credit and the work really isn't too hard. Only two required performances,  and the final. Minute posts each week and sometimes an easy quiz. (You can take the quizzes up to three times.)
